H0.text: Proteins, when broken down during digestion, can increase the body's fructose levels.

H1.text: Vitamins are a type of molecule that could be broken down during digestion to increase the body's fructose levels by producing fructose from the breakdown of larger molecules.

H2.text: Triglycerides are a type of molecule that could be broken down during digestion to increase the body's fructose levels.

H3.text: Carbohydrates are the type of molecules that, when broken down during digestion, increase the body's fructose levels.

A6.text: Fructose exists in foods either as a monosaccharide (free fructose) or as a unit of a disaccharide (sucrose). When fructose is consumed in the form of sucrose, it is digested (broken down) and then absorbed as free fructose.
